item.title: Staffing Slashed, Mortality Rises: The Private Equity Effect
item.description: Authors of a new study found that patient outcomes suffered in the wake of private investor purchases of hospitals. Medscape Medical News

item.title: Life Expectancy Gains Slow: Is 100 Years Out of Reach?
item.description: Cohort data suggest that future generations may add fewer months of life than those born a century ago. Medscape Medical News

item.title: Early-Onset CRC Often Detected at Advanced Stage
item.description: At a safety-net hospital in Texas, most adults younger than 50 years with colorectal cancer were diagnosed at an advanced stage, with non-Hispanic Bla...

item.title: Autoimmune Skin Diseases Linked to Blood Cancer Risk
item.description: Autoimmune skin diseases are associated with a higher risk for blood cancers, while blistering diseases show no association in a study. Medscape Medic...

item.title: Are Short-Course Corticosteroids Safe for Children?
item.description: Short-course systemic corticosteroids in children and adolescents were associated with adverse events that were rarely serious. Medscape Medical News
